# Underwater Dive and Recovery Services – Alberta

## Announcement

The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) is seeking a contractor to provide underwater dive and recovery services at potential crime scenes located throughout the Province of Alberta.

### Request for Proposal

The RCMP requires a commercial diving operation to recover human remains and/or evidence search and recovery services on an "as needed and when requested" basis. The contract will be for a period of two years with an irrevocable option to extend for an additional one-year period.

### Criteria for Selection

To be considered responsive, bidders must comply with the requirements of the bid solicitation and meet all mandatory technical evaluation criteria. The responsive bid with the lowest evaluated price will be recommended for award of a contract.

### Submission Requirements

Tenders must be submitted to the RCMP Bid Receiving Unit at NWR_Procurement_Bids@rcmp-grc.gc.ca. Refer to the attached tender documents for further information.

### Security Clearance

All contractors and their personnel/subcontractors must hold a valid "RCMP Enhanced Reliability Status (ERS)" Security Clearance issued by the RCMP Departmental Security.

### Commercial and Trade Agreements

The procurement is subject to the Integrity Regime administered by Public Services and Procurement Canada. Additionally, the procurement is open to all eligible suppliers, regardless of their nationality, residency, or place of establishment.

### Indigenous Procurement

The federal Indigenous Business Directory (IBD) is an online resource for all levels of government and the private sector to identify Indigenous business capacity. Having a business profile in the IBD can increase a company's visibility and allow them to compete for federal government contracts that are set-aside for Indigenous businesses.

### Contact Information

For more information, please contact Sheena Simonson at sheena.simonson@rcmp-grc.gc.ca or 306-515-1653.

### Tender Documents

The tender documents can be downloaded from the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) at https://canadabuys.canada.ca. All amendments, including significant enquiries received and their replies, will be posted on GETS.

### Closing Date and Time

The tender closing date and time is April 28, 2023 at 16:00:00.
